title: The Vision of John A. Browning
subtitle: A Founder's Philosophy
description: Explore our founder's educational philosophy through handwritten letters, early administrative documents, and rare photographs from the 1870s. Discover how John A. Browning's revolutionary ideas about character-based education shaped the school that bears his name.

chapters.description: John A. Browning's early writings reveal his commitment to holistic education.

chapters.description: Photographs and records of the inaugural class of 12 boys.

title: A Day in the Life: Browning in the 1950s
subtitle: Post-War Student Experience
description: Step back into post-war student life with class photos, newspaper articles, event programs, and candid snapshots from the era. Experience the optimism and energy of Browning during America's golden age.

title: The Evolution of the Arts at Browning
subtitle: A Century of Creative Expression
description: A multimedia journey through decades of creativityfrom early theater productions to choir performances and art exhibitions. Witness how the arts program has grown from modest beginnings to a cornerstone of Browning education.

chapters.description: Stage productions from 1912 to present day.

title: The Athletic Legacy
subtitle: Champions and Team Spirit
description: From the first baseball team in 1895 to modern championship squads, explore how athletics has shaped character, built community, and created lifelong memories for Browning students.

subtitle: Buildings, Spaces, and Growth
description: Follow the physical evolution of The Browning School from rented rooms to modern facilities. See how each location shaped the student experience and reflected the changing needs of education.

subtitle: Service, Sacrifice, and Resilience
